H0.text: Moisture is what the ceramic tile covering the bottom of the space shuttle can withstand, which is why the material was chosen.

H1.text: Vibration is the condition that the ceramic tile covering the bottom of the space shuttle is chosen to withstand.

H2.text: Heat is the condition that the ceramic tiles covering the bottom of the space shuttle are chosen to withstand.

H3.text: Light is what the ceramic tile covering the bottom of the space shuttle can withstand, which is why that material was chosen.

A4.text: The Space Shuttle thermal protection system (TPS) is the barrier that protected the Space Shuttle Orbiter during the extreme 1,650 °C (3,000 °F) heat of atmospheric reentry.

A5.text: The insulation prevented heat transfer to the underlying orbiter aluminium skin and structure.
